isis.stitle: ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM: BENDIX - 3900 - AR-1 ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE - OPERATION AND LEAK TESTS - AR-1 ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE

svcproc.title: OPERATION AND LEAK TESTS - AR-1 ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE

step1.para: Apply and release the brakes several times while a helper checks for prompt application and release at each wheel. If prompt reaction is noted at some, but not all wheels, test the antilock modulator between the AR-1 and the brake actuator for proper operation. If a "sluggish" response is noted at all wheels, inspect for a kinked or obstructed air line leading to or from the AR-1.

If some, but not all,brakes release completely, test the antilock modulator between the AR-1 and the brake actuator. If an incomplete release is noted at all wheels, inspect for a kinked or clogged air line leading to or from the AR-1.

During brake release, confirm that a slight "puff" of air exits at the AR-1's quick exhaust port in the cover. Air exiting at this exhaust port indicates the AR-1 integral quick release is functioning.
Build the air system pressure to governor cut-out, and apply a soap solution to the exhaust port in body. The leakage noted should not exceed a one-inch bubble in less than three (3) seconds.

Make and hold a full brake application and apply a soap solution to the exhaust ports in the body, cover, and around the cover where it joins the body. The leakage noted should not exceed a one-inch bubble in less than three (3) seconds at any exhaust port.
